title: Golden Circle & Hot Springs

image.alt: Golden Circle landscape with geysir eruption and dramatic clouds

quote.text: The real voyage of discovery consists not in seeking new landscapes, but in having new eyes.
quote.author: Marcel Proust

shortSummary: Explore Iceland's Golden Circle featuring the historic √ûingvellir National Park, erupting Strokkur geyser, and thundering Gullfoss waterfall, ending with a natural hot spring river hike.
summary: Today you'll explore Iceland's famous Golden Circle, a route that showcases some of the country's most spectacular natural wonders. From the historical √ûingvellir National Park where tectonic plates meet, to the powerful Gullfoss waterfall and erupting Strokkur geyser, today offers iconic Icelandic landscapes. End your day with a relaxing soak in a natural hot river after a scenic hike through geothermal landscapes.

schedule.title: Breakfast at Hotel Fr√≥n
schedule.description: Enjoy breakfast at your hotel before departing for the Golden Circle. Early departure recommended to beat the crowds at popular sites.

schedule.title: Drive to √ûingvellir National Park
schedule.description: Head east from Reykjav√≠k to your first Golden Circle destination.

schedule.title: √ûingvellir National Park
schedule.description: Explore this UNESCO World Heritage site where you can walk between the North American and Eurasian tectonic plates. Visit the historic parliament site, Almannagj√° gorge, and enjoy panoramic views across the park.
details: Site of Iceland's first parliament established in 930 AD
Walk in the rift between two continental plates
quickStops: Law Rock viewpoint - historically where laws were announced

schedule.title: Geysir Geothermal Area
schedule.description: Witness Strokkur geyser erupting every 5-7 minutes, sending water up to 30 meters in the air. Explore the surrounding geothermal area with bubbling mud pools and steaming vents.
details: The original Great Geysir (now mostly dormant) gave all geysers their name
Various colored hot springs and mud pots to observe
quickStops: Geysir Center gift shop and restaurant

schedule.title: Gullfoss Waterfall
schedule.description: Experience the raw power of this massive two-tiered waterfall as it thunders down into a rugged canyon. Multiple viewing platforms allow you to appreciate the falls from different angles.
details: Two-stage waterfall dropping 32 meters (105 ft) into a 70-meter deep canyon
On sunny days, rainbows often appear in the mist
In winter, parts of the falls freeze creating dramatic ice formations

schedule.title: Lunch at Fri√∞heimar Tomato Greenhouse
schedule.description: Enjoy a unique dining experience at this working tomato farm where you'll eat lunch surrounded by growing tomato plants. Their famous tomato soup with fresh-baked bread is a highlight.

schedule.title: Reykjadalur Hot Spring Thermal River Hike
schedule.description: Take a moderate 3-mile round trip hike (approximately 2 hours total) through a geothermal area to reach a natural hot river where you can bathe in the warm waters. This was highly recommended by your friends as a highlight experience.
details: 3-mile (5 km) round trip hike with 200m elevation gain
Multiple steaming vents and bubbling mud pots along the trail
The river has different temperature zones - move upstream for hotter water
Simple wooden platforms for changing clothes

schedule.title: Check in at Country Dream Guesthouse
schedule.description: Arrive at your accommodation in Selfoss and get settled for the evening.

schedule.title: Dinner in Selfoss
schedule.description: Enjoy dinner at Tryggvask√°li, a historical restaurant in a renovated bridge house along the river. This restaurant is known for its locally-sourced ingredients and Icelandic specialties.

highlights: The thundering cascade of Gullfoss waterfall
Bathing in the natural hot river at Reykjadalur

accommodation.name: Country Dream guesthouse
accommodation.notes: Stock up on groceries in Selfoss as it's the largest town before continuing east.

alternatives.description: A 3,000-year-old volcanic crater lake with vivid blue water contrasting against red volcanic rock. Easy walking path around the rim and down to the water.
alternatives.location: Near Selfoss, on the Golden Circle route

alternatives.title: Faxi Waterfall
alternatives.description: A smaller but beautiful waterfall near the Golden Circle route. Less crowded than the main attractions with a salmon ladder visible on one side.

alternatives.description: Known as 'Iceland's Bluest Waterfall.' A 7 km (4.3 mile) round trip hike leads to this stunning blue waterfall. Allow 2.5-3 hours for the complete hike.

badWeatherAlternatives.title: Laugarvatn Fontana
badWeatherAlternatives.description: Geothermal baths, steam rooms, and hot pools. They also offer a unique geothermal bread-making experience.
badWeatherAlternatives.location: On the way back from Gullfoss to Selfoss

badWeatherAlternatives.title: Lj√≥safossst√∂√∞ Power Station Visitor Center
badWeatherAlternatives.description: Interactive exhibition about renewable energy in Iceland, including hands-on displays about hydroelectric, geothermal, and wind power.

badWeatherAlternatives.title: Efstidalur II Farm
badWeatherAlternatives.description: Farm-to-table restaurant and ice cream barn where you can enjoy dairy products while watching the cows that produced the milk.

tip: Pack a swimsuit, towel, and water shoes for Reykjadalur. There are no changing facilities except for simple wooden platforms, so consider wearing your swimsuit under your clothes if the weather is good.
notes: The Golden Circle is Iceland's most popular tourist route, so early morning departures help avoid crowds. If it's raining, consider postponing Reykjadalur and substituting one of the indoor alternatives.
